summary: This is an email from defense attorney Laura Menninger to Judge Nathan requesting an adjournment of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial and seeking to redact other clients' names from the motion, citing attorney-client confidentiality rules.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C. who is writing to Judge Nathan on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell to request an adjournment of the trial and redaction of other clients' names.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over the US v. Maxwell case, addressed in the email regarding the request for trial adjournment.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the Maxwell case adjournment request.

persons.name: Bobbi Stemhenn
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the Maxwell case adjournment request.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the Maxwell case adjournment request.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case US v. Maxwell, whose counsel is requesting a trial adjournment.

connections.description: Menninger is acting as defense counsel for Maxwell, filing motions on her behalf.
Menninger is communicating with Judge Nathan regarding court procedures and motions in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: Judge Nathan issued an order (Dkt. 221) related to the Maxwell case procedures.

events.title: Request for Trial Adjournment
events.description: Defense counsel Laura Menninger files a letter motion requesting a 120 or 180-day adjournment of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.

keyFacts: Defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell requested a significant adjournment (120-180 days) of her trial in April 2021.
The defense cited attorney-client confidentiality rules (Rule of Professional Conduct 1.6) to request redaction of other clients' names from court filings.
The email references legal precedents from Indiana, Kansas, and Oklahoma supporting the confidentiality argument.
The document shows ongoing legal maneuvering in the Maxwell case nearly a year after her arrest.
